com.tacttiles.api

Class Device

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tacttiles.api.Device

  • public class Device
extends java.lang.Object
    A Device is a hardware abstraction that handles the low level communication protocol used in devices compatibles with the Tact-Tiles platform.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Device.DeviceListener
      A device listener receives notifications of new data available in the Device object.

      void addListener(Device.DeviceListener deviceListener)
      Adds a listener to the current set of event listeners of this adapter.

      Connects this adapter to the Tact-Tiles runtime service, which handles the bluetooth communication and device access.
      RuntimeConnection getServiceConnection()
      Returns the service connection of this device.
      protected void onDeviceFound()
      Called when the bluetooth device is connected.
      protected void onDeviceLost()
      Called when the bluetooth device connection is lost or the device is not connected.

      Called when a bluetooth message is received by the runtime service and this device is properly connected.
      void powerOff()
      Power the connected device off.

      Send a low level message to the physical device.

        public Device()

    • Method Detail

      • getServiceConnection

        public RuntimeConnection getServiceConnection()
        Returns the service connection of this device.
        Returns:
        The service connection of this device.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(Device.DeviceListener deviceListener)
        Adds a listener to the current set of event listeners of this adapter. Events can be system status or user interaction related events.
        Parameters:
        deviceListener - The listener to be added to the current set of listeners on this adapter.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(Device.DeviceListener deviceListener)
        Removes a listener from the set listening to this adapter.
        Parameters:
        deviceListener - The listener to be removed to the current set of listeners on this adapter.

      • connect

        public void connect(Context appContext)
        Connects this adapter to the Tact-Tiles runtime service, which handles the bluetooth communication and device access.
        Parameters:
        appContext - The current context of this application.

      • onMessage

        protected void onMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        Called when a bluetooth message is received by the runtime service and this device is properly connected.
        Parameters:
        msg - Message contents.

      • onDeviceFound

        protected void onDeviceFound()
        Called when the bluetooth device is connected.

      • onDeviceLost

        protected void onDeviceLost()
        Called when the bluetooth device connection is lost or the device is not connected.

      • powerOff

        public void powerOff()
        Power the connected device off.

      • requestBatteryStatus

        public void requestBatteryStatus()
        Request the battery status.

      • vibrateDevice

        public void vibrateDevice(int times,
                          int duration)
        Vibrates the physical device.
        Parameters:
        times - Number of pulses.
        duration - Duration in milliseconds of the on and off state.

      • setTouchSensibility

        public void setTouchSensibility(int sensibility)
        Sets the touch sensibility of the device's tiles. The value passed is proportional to the sensibility.
        Parameters:
        sensibility - Integer in the range [0, 16].

      • send

        public void send(byte[] msg)
        Send a low level message to the physical device.
        Parameters:
        msg - Message to be sent.

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String msg)
        Send a low level message to the physical device in a more human readable form.
        Parameters:
        msg - Message to be sent.
